title: ComicIssue
description:
Individual comic issues are serially published as
    	part of a larger series. For the sake of consistency, even one-shot issues
    	belong to a series comprised of a single issue. All comic issues can be
    	uniquely identified by: the combination of the name and volume number of the
    	series to which the issue belongs; the issue number; and the variant
    	description of the issue (if any).

allOf.description: A part of a successively published publication such as a periodical or publication volume, often numbered, usually containing a grouping of works such as articles.\n\nSee also [blog post](http://blog.schema.org/2014/09/schemaorg-support-for-bibliographic_2.html).

artist.description:
The primary artist for a work
    	in a medium other than pencils or digital line art--for example, if the
    	primary artwork is done in watercolors or digital paints.

colorist.description: The individual who adds color to inked drawings.

inker.description: The individual who traces over the pencil drawings in ink after pencils are complete.

letterer.description: The individual who adds lettering, including speech balloons and sound effects, to artwork.

penciler.description: The individual who draws the primary narrative artwork.

variantCover.description:
A description of the variant cover
    	for the issue, if the issue is a variant printing. For example, "Bryan Hitch
    	Variant Cover" or "2nd Printing Variant".
